page.title: 12HOME LIFE IN CALLANDER
page.content: In Callander the{family unit }is still important.We have an increasing number of one parent families and a few extended families. Up to 42 domestic{electric appliances} assist in food preparation,in the care of clothes and in gardening.Leisure time is increasing and every home has at least one T.V.,which is watched regularly.Many children have their own T.V.'s,radios,stereos and cassette recorders as well as computers.The average family has 2 children but they have little responsibility for {household chores } or the care of pets. Fathers help a little in the running of the home but take greater interest in the garden or car. Whole families participate in games,sports,outings and holidays.
